message: I just released  a new web app called Linkchirp. It's a service that pulls in your tweet feed, parses it for links, then indexes them for searching and filtering. This is a side project of mine. It was something I wanted so I built it and figured some other people would like it too.
@joshj Very clean design. Love the little tweak that you do to the header when I start to scroll. How do you get the titles of shortened urls?
Sweet! Was Chirplink taken? Rolls off the tongue better
@jskopek Thanks! I built a little script that goes and gets the full URL then parses the page for the title tag.
@sstave. Thanks for the comment. I just checked and it was bought in 2008. In all honesty I did not even check until just now. I liked how linkchirp sounded so I got it. :)
@joshj Suspected that might be the case, but I'm impressed at how quickly it runs
Nice app! I'm used to read content from websites' twitter accounts and it's cool to keep track of every link
and isn't tehere a way to use the bookmarklet code? or something? I don't feel confortable in giving my instapaper login to every app
Ya.
I did not like that either.
anyway, nice project :)
Thanks! :)
mmmm... I just pushed the feature up late last night so I will grab that bug too. Thanks for the feedback.
Instapaper integration is working?
Thanks!
Let me check it out.
It's my own app and I did not want to give my username and password :_
It should be.
Ah. - The ajax loaded links are not working for the instapaper.
I need to call the javascript once the links a pulled in. I will push up a change in a couple mins.
Ah after refresh it worked (asks for my user/pass, but when I click Cancel, popup doesn't disappear)
I will need to look into another option.
lol. True.
Now I need another app to remember all the websites where I'm registered on, and another that reminds me to use that app when I need to do exactly that.. Uff.. internet life is sooo complicated..

@joshj  nice work, i had similar project idea, you got it going. most of the times we tweet our favorite content and forget the links later. i have a thought to add here, can we work around this app making easy to browse through our own tweets? i mean filtering links, tags from our own feed. why bother bookmarking the link you just tweeted?
Site is down for me : (
But out of interest what kind of tech powers it?
@matwill I am sorry the site was down for you. It is running CodeIgniter.
@bhu1st Thanks! If I am understanding, I completely agree. Do you think it would be nice to have a tab for your own tweets filtered out? So it's just your tweets showing. Thanks for the input.
@dellak Hi
@Leech I will check that out. Thanks for the link.
hi room
I would like to see the images and videos inline, and the links expanded, if possible
for images and videos you may use embed.ly
Man that embedly is awesome.
@joshj its back up since then, looks great! Which route did you go for hosting?
Amazon AWS.
I am very impressed.
@joshj twitter has no easy way to traverse through or search through our own tweets. this actually sucks when you want to re-visit the link you tweeted few weeks ago. yes, adding tab would be great.
Ok, Thumbnails are in. :)
@joshj you should provide a fixed width to the embed.ly for the videos to avoid this: http://metele.in/Zawq
@joshj awesome :)
mmm... That's strange. I am passing the maxwidth var to embedly.
I will have to look into it more.
Thanks for the screenshot.
Nice app. I love the look and it's very easily scannable and nice for quick peaks into my twitter world.
@bryanpearson Thanks for checking it out! :)
Sorry for the slowness today. I am working on some MySQL issues.
I have created a new group for feedback and support. If you are interested in LinkChirps development you can check it out here. https://convore.com/linkchirp/
Checking back after several days.
Your logo looks like cloudapp. Not saying it's bad, but thought you'd want to know they're pretty similar.
